taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section tholiformes;species paludivagus;

treatment.description: Primocanes at first simple, soon intricately branching, 3-6 mm. thick, at first puberulent; becoming glabrate, stiffly armed with subulate prickles 5 mm. long and 2-3 mm. broad at base; primocane-leaflets 5, strigose-pilose above, velvety beneath, oblong or narrowly lance-ovate, serrate, acuminate, the terminal one one-third to less than half as broad as long (2.5-3.7 cm. wide); membranaceous floricane-leaflets acuminate; pedicels loosely ascending, minutely pilose, the longer ones 2-5 cm. long, mostly unarmed; calyx-lobes 3-5 mm. long, unarmed, scarcely reflexed in fruit; petals 1-1.5 cm. long, 6-7 mm. broad; fruit 1.5 cm. in diameter, of rich quality.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Wet thickets and bogs, Cape Cod, Mass. Fl. mid-June, early July; fr. late Aug.
